recipe.name: Feta Marinated with Herbs and Chilli
recipe.description: A cost effective starter that tastes as delightful as it looks and takes minutes to prepare. You could also make this just by serving a whole block of feta, but cutting it into cubes makes it easier to serve and also you get a better feta/olive oil/herb ratio with every bite!
recipeIngredient: 8 oz / 250 g   feta cheese (, preferably Danish or another creamy type (see notes))
2 tbsp herbs (, finely chopped. (I used parsley and thyme leaves))
1  birds eye chilli (, finely chopped (or any fresh red chilli of choice))

recipeInstructions.text: Infuse olive oil with garlic (optional): use the side of your knife to smash the garlic cloves and combine with the olive oil. Cover, refrigerate and leave for as long as possible - a few hours or preferably overnight.
recipeInstructions.name: Infuse olive oil with garlic (optional): use the side of your knife to smash the garlic cloves and combine with the olive oil. Cover, refrigerate and leave for as long as possible - a few hours or preferably overnight.

recipeInstructions.text: If you do not have the time to do Step 1, just mince 1 garlic clove (small) and stir into the olive oil.
recipeInstructions.name: If you do not have the time to do Step 1, just mince 1 garlic clove (small) and stir into the olive oil.

recipeInstructions.text: Cut the feta into bite size cubes - about 1cm / 1/3 inch.
recipeInstructions.name: Cut the feta into bite size cubes - about 1cm / 1/3 inch.

recipeInstructions.text: Place feta into serving dish, scatter over herbs, chilli, lemon rind and a grind of black pepper.
recipeInstructions.name: Place feta into serving dish, scatter over herbs, chilli, lemon rind and a grind of black pepper.

recipeInstructions.text: Pour over olive oil. Serve with crusty bread.

review.reviewBody: I made with parsley, chives and dill.  Was incredible. Good level of spice - not too alienating for guests but still a good zing.

Hi Nagi - long time 'user' [of your delicious recipes], first time 'caller' !

A question on the oil – I have made this recipe and it is without doubt delicious (the lemon rind is genius). But I found that the olive oil solidified in the fridge.

The store bought varieties don't seem to suffer from this – and whilst I love & prefer olive oil (being Italian it’s like our lifeblood !), I wonder should I use a different type of oil for this recipe ?  What are your thoughts ?

Or maybe I just continue to bring it out of the fridge 10-15mins before use - which is a bit of a pain, but perhaps worth it for the superior flavour of the oil.
Thank you. This was delicious and got better and better as it sat in the fridge. Thank you once again. I am going to have to make sure I always have some of this in the fridge. Delicious!!!!

Right, so I made these for Christmas day and while I thought they were pretty good my family didn't take to them. All I can say is THANK GOODNESS for that because I just pulled the left overs out of the fridge for a midnight snack and HOLY COW, do they get better with sitting for a day or two. I will be making this again and not telling anyone so I can keep them in the fridge for when I want them.
This is the easiest but best recipe! My friends request that I make this for every gathering!!

Nagi -- this collection of recipes is a treasure!! Thank you so much for sharing. I made all but the koftas and the chickpea salad when we had a couple friends over for dinner last Friday. We loved every dish, and I will make all of them again in the future! It took me longer than an hour, maybe closer to an hour and a half, but I chalk that up to being unfamiliar with the recipes. Still super quick for putting together such an amazing, restaurant-quality spread!

Ok. Our youngest daughter (13) is allergic to cow milk (not lactose intolerant, allergic) & she LOVES her goat & sheep feta. I had her make this for our NYE celebration tonight. She added the chilli into the oil, along with the garlic. She let the oil sit for about 4 hrs before mixing it all together. I have to say that watching her drizzle the oil was PAINFUL; she was doing it drop by drop. I finally stopped her & asked what was wrong. 
"I'm scared"
"Of what sweetie?"
She tenses her face & says "I'm scared this will make my cheese taste gross"
"Beth, it's ok to be scared....but you have to trust Nagi. She says this is a really good dish"
With resignation she dumped the oil on, tossed the feta, grabbed a toothpick & took a bite. 
"OMG Mom!! THIS IS SO GOOD!!!"

You've done it again Nagi. I give this recipe TEN STARS!! You're the best! 
All our love from Canada & Happy New Year!
